review.body: An enthralling page turner that you cannot put down, but extremely violent.

book.title: フェアリーテイル 39 [Fearī Teiru 39] (Fairy Tail, #39)

review.body: i really like this one. especially ultear

book.title: I'll Ride For My Hood: A Salty Love Story

review.body:
Another Winner

I enjoyed this book. It's still Salty. Most of this was already done in the Salty Series. It just gave the missing details of Paris and Hood. I was expecting something different because we already saw how it ends unless this will have a different ending? Well, we have to wait and se...

Okay

This was slow going but got good near the end. It had some funny lines too. I was trying to figure out where this was going. Lol. I still don't know. But there's something here that makes me want to see what's going to happen. I mean if I had a friend like Armani, I would just cut her off but...

book.title: Washing Day and other Sharecropper's Stories

review.body: Dick Meadows has done a wonderful job with sharing his growing up in small town usa. Well written and enjoyable to read. Looking forward to reading more by this author.
Not nearly as much story here as The Dark Knight Returns, but I enjoyed the more focused look at Batman and Jim Gordon, plus I preferred the art style in this book over TDKR.

This is one of those books whose every word needs to be savored. Schofield has given thought to the thoughts of “our woman” and carefully crafted them into this book. And in doing so she has given unique insight to the mind and the pains it endures.

http://tinyurl.com/hu9ashu

book.title: This Is Water: Some Thoughts, Delivered on a Significant Occasion, about Living a Compassionate Life

review.body: I go through this one again every 2-3 months.
very difficult to read for me
I really enjoyed this book. The series is realy gripping. I thought I had this one figured out but not quite. Looking forward to the next one!

Smart and funny. I usually have trouble "getting" the humor in books, but this one, told in the dry witty style of Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, made me laugh. And Samuel is a great middle-grade character.
Loved being immersed in this world. Reading this series was great - listening to it on audio afterwards was even more fun. I liked knowing the correct pronunciations. Good orator as well.

I enjoyed this story and laughed out loud countless times. Julia is a clothing designer who enjoys her work and has numerous models and celebrities as clients. Ben is a client and a drummer in a band. They have an instant connection that is both exciting and terrifying.

I received a free copy in...

book.title: This Book Is Full of Spiders: Seriously, Dude, Don't Touch It (John Dies at the End, #2)

review.body: worth reading the first one to really follow this one, which is thematically and stylistically superior in almost every way. very enjoyable.

Today I finished the LONG, 412 page novel by Cassandra King (who happens to be the wife of Pat Conroy, one of the most talented writers living today---If you have never read The Prince of Tides, it should be on your short list-----) called The Queen of Broken Hearts. The novel is set in Alabama a...
Good story outline. The idea of the book was good, the way it was written not so much.

Good mystery

Very good book and holds your interest, many interesting twists and turns. A very good who done it. I really enjoyed this book.

book.title: I, Fly: The Buzz About Flies and How Awesome They Are

review.body: Listed in CCBC Choices 2016 under Science, Technology and the Natural World. Don't read this book at dinnertime! Hilarious and informative narration by a fly who lectures a classroom about their fascination with butterflies. I learned a great deal about flies, and particularly like the Q & A....

book.title: Tafsir Al Misbah: Pesan, Kesan dan Keserasian Al-Quran Vol. 2 (Tafsir Al-Mishbah, #2)

review.body: Tafsir Al Misbah: Pesan, Kesan dan Keserasian Al-Quran Vol. 1

This book ended the series for me. It was only OK. Quite scary for a bunch of angels going around killing each other and all kinds of terrifying creatures even though they were made of hot air. I'm done and if you feel the same way this book Kinda ties up the loose ends just well enough to move o...
